DataElement.preferredName: Smoking PATH Cigarette Risk Perception Questionnaire 1 Brand Harmfulness Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The act of puffing and/or inhaling smoke from a lit cigarette, cigar, or pipe._A national longitudinal study of tobacco use and how it affects the health of people in the United States. It is designed to learn how and why people start using tobacco products, quit using them, and start using them again after they?ve quit, as well as how different tobacco products affect health outcomes over time._Finely cut tobacco encased in a wrapper of thin paper and rolled for smoking._The potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable._The process of producing an internal, conscious image through stimulating a sensory system; it involves the recognition that stimulation has occurred, and the ability to discriminate various aspects of the stimulus._A predetermined set of questions._The part of the name or logo associated with a specific product or service identifying and distinguishing it from varieties of the same product or service marketed by competing companies._A set of descriptors to assess the relative perceived harmfulness of something.

Property.preferredName: Population Assessment of Tobacco and Health (PATH) Study Cigarette Risk Perception Questionnaire Proprietary Name
Property.preferredDefinition: A national longitudinal study of tobacco use and how it affects the health of people in the United States. It is designed to learn how and why people start using tobacco products, quit using them, and start using them again after they've quit, as well as how different tobacco products affect health outcomes over time.:Finely cut tobacco encased in a wrapper of thin paper and rolled for smoking.:The potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable.:The process of producing an internal, conscious image through stimulating a sensory system; it involves the recognition that stimulation has occurred, and the ability to discriminate various aspects of the stimulus.:A predetermined set of questions.:The part of the name or logo associated with a specific product or service identifying and distinguishing it from varieties of the same product or service marketed by competing companies.

Concepts.longName: Population Assessment of Tobacco and Health (PATH) Study
Concepts.definition: A national longitudinal study of tobacco use and how it affects the health of people in the United States. It is designed to learn how and why people start using tobacco products, quit using them, and start using them again after they've quit, as well as how different tobacco products affect health outcomes over time.
Finely cut tobacco encased in a wrapper of thin paper and rolled for smoking.
The potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable.

The process of producing an internal, conscious image through stimulating a sensory system; it involves the recognition that stimulation has occurred, and the ability to discriminate various aspects of the stimulus.
The part of the name or logo associated with a specific product or service identifying and distinguishing it from varieties of the same product or service marketed by competing companies.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Do you think the brand of cig
ReferenceDocuments.description: Do you think the brand of cigarettes you [usually smoke | usually smoked | last smoked] might be less harmful, no different, or more harmful, compared to other cigarette brands?
